intro: Euphrasia borsei, commonly known as the Balkan eyebright, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan region of Europe. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family, which includes parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and hairy, oval-shaped leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and meadows. Euphrasia borsei is often used in traditional medicine for its purported eye health benefits.
